alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 4:49PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Fremont County through 530 PM MDT... At 447 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorm centered 8 miles northeast of Texas Creek, or 20 miles northeast of Hayden Pass Burn Scar, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and locally heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause rock or mud slides on highway 50 during the heavier rainfall. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Fremont County between Texas Creek and Royal Gorge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northwestern Fremont County Above 8500Ft; Western, Central Fremont County Below 8500 Ft
